Title:
Phylogenetic placement of the genus Anhellia and the
description of A. nectandrae sp. nov.
Keywords:
Black scab, Dothideomycetes, Dothideomycetidae,
Myriangiales, tropical fungi
Abstract:
The phylogenetic position of a new species of Anhellia
(Myriangiales) was investigated for the first time using nucleotide
sequences of large subunit ribosomal. The new sequence of these regions
was aligned with 28 sequences obtained from GenBank, including four
species of Davidiellaceae (Capnodiales) used as outgroup. This is the
first study in trying to resolve the placement of the genus Anhellia
within Myriangiales. The data show that Myriangiales are related group
with Dothideales. The genus Anhellia was highly supported in
Myriangiaceae by phylogenetic analyzes. In addition, A. nectandrae sp.
nov., collected on Nectandra rigida in a fragment of Atlantic forest in
Brazil, is described, illustrated and a table with morphological
features to all known Anhellia species are provided.
